newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nissei Sangyo shares up in Tokyo on dividend news.
newsitem.headline: Nissei Sangyo shares up in Tokyo on dividend news.

text.p: Shares in Japanese food trader Nissei Sangyo Co Ltd rose in Tokyo afternoon trade on Wednesday after the company announced that it would pay a commemorative dividend for this fiscal year.

By 0455 GMT, the shares had climbed 110 yen, or 8.21 percent, to 1,450 yen, making the company the fourth largest percentage gainer on the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange. Turnover was 147,000.

On Tuesday, Nissei Sangyo announced that the company planned to pay a commemorative dividend of 12.50 yen per share for the year to March 31, 1997, in addition to an ordinary dividend of 12.50 yen per share.
